intro: Psoralea plicifolia, commonly known as the pleated psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive pleated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Psoralea plicifolia is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it adapts well to arid conditions. Its unique leaf structure and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
